data.text:
Indian film studioTemplate:SHORTDESC:Indian film studio

Template:Use Indian English

Red Giant Movies is an Indian film production and distribution company headed by actor, politician and businessman Udhayanidhi Stalin. It has distributed nearly all major films in Tamil Nadu, and often accused of having monopoly in Tamil market.[1][2][3]

History[]

The proposed venture of the studio was meant to be a collaboration between director Thamizhvaanan and actor Vishal, but the film never took off.[4] Subsequently, the first production of Red Giant Movies was the action comedy Kuruvi (2008) starring Vijay, following which the studio financed K. S. Ravikumar's Aadhavan (2009) starring Suriya.[5] The studio later worked on big budget films including the Kamal Haasan-starrer Manmadan Ambu (2010) and AR Murugadoss's 7aum Arivu (2011).

The studio received acclaim in 2010, when all four of its distribution projects, Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa, Madrasapattinam, Boss Engira Bhaskaran and Mynaa became commercial successes.[6] In the case of Mynaa, the studio received praise for backing and choosing to purchase a small budget film and helping market it as a bigger film.[7] Since the end of 2011, Red Giant Movies has concentrated solely on producing films starring Udhayanidhi Stalin. The production house revived its widespread operations in the production and distribution of films after 2021. Red Giant Movies is currently established as the leading production house in the Tamil film industry with numerous blockbusters released under their banner including Vikram (2022). Red Giant Movies recently joined hands with Kamal Haasan's Raj Kamal Films International (RKFI) for the star's greatly anticipated film to be directed by maverick filmmaker Mani Ratnam.

Filmography[]

Films produced[]

Year Title Director Cast Synopsis Page Template:Tooltip/styles.css has no content. 2008 Kuruvi Vijay, Trisha, Suman, Vivek A man embarks on a quest to save his father who has been kept captive by a gangster. [8] 2009 Aadhavan Suriya, Nayanthara, Rahul Dev, Vadivelu An assassin poses as a servant to murder a judge who happens to be his father. [9] 2010 Manmadhan Ambu Kamal Haasan, Trisha, Madhavan A suspicious boyfriend sets up a detective to spy on his girlfriend. 2011 7aum Arivu Suriya, Shruti Haasan, Johnny Tri Nguyen Circus artist who comes from the lineage of Bodhidharma join hands with a doctor against people who spread diseases. [10] 2012 Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Udhayanidhi Stalin, Hansika Motwani, Santhanam Youth who is torn between his best friend and girlfriend. [11] 2012 Neerparavai Vishnu Vishal, Sunaina, Nandita Das, Samuthirakani Fisherman's wife waits for the return of her husband who is presumed to be dead. [12] 2013 Vanakkam Chennai Shiva, Priya Anand, Rahul Ravindran A boy and girl who is forced to stay in the same place initially hates each other but falls in love. [13] 2014 Idhu Kathirvelan Kadhal Udhayanidhi Stalin, Nayanthara, Santhanam A man along with his friend together indulges to unite both of his families. [14] 2015 Nannbenda Jagadish Udhayanidhi Stalin, Nayanthara, Santhanam, Sherin A man along with his friend are on a quest to prove their innocence for a murder which they haven't committed. [15] 2016 Gethu Thirukumaran Udhayanidhi Stalin, Amy Jackson, Sathyaraj, Vikranth A man is on a quest to save his father who is wrongly accused of murdering someone. [16] 2016 Manithan Udhayanidhi Stalin, Hansika Motwani, Prakash Raj A struggling young lawyer decides to take up the hit-and-run case where he is pitted against a successful lawyer. [17] 2017 Saravanan Irukka Bayamaen Udhayanidhi Stalin, Regina Cassandra, Srushti Dange, Soori In order to woo his childhood sweetheart, a man seeks the help of his college mate's ghost to solve it. [18] 2019 Kanne Kalaimaane Udhayanidhi Stalin, Tamannaah Kamalakannan, an organic farmer, marries to Bharathi, a bank manager. However, Kamalakannan's grandmother does not want Bharathi to work after marriage, that leads to a tussle between them. 2022 Kalaga Thalaivan Magizh Thirumeni Udhayanidhi Stalin, Nidhhi Agerwal Thirumaaran, a financial analyst swiftly climbs up the corporate ladder. Soon, his world is turned upside down as he is confronted by a mysterious deadly group led by a brutal killer. Throughout the story, we see how he copes with the situation. 2023 Maamannan Mari Selvaraj Vadivelu, Udhayanidhi Stalin, Fahadh Faasil Released on June 29 2024 Indian 2 S. Shankar Kamal Haasan, Kajal Agarwal Post Production Thug Life Mani Ratnam Kamal Hassan, Jayam Ravi, Dulquer Salman, Trisha Filming [19]

Films distributed[]

In addition to the films produced by Red Giant Movies since 2008, the following films from other banners were distributed by the company:
